question.title: How to handle empty/null lists in a sql "IN" statement?
question.body:
I have a List that is given as a parameter to a query method like so:

@Query(value = "SELECT n FROM Names n WHERE n.name IN (:names)"
public List<NameDTO> getNames(@Param("names") List<String> names);

The problem is that because the names list can be empty or null, this query will not execute. You can add a guard that checks if names is null before executing the IN clause but hibernate will not be tricked this way. I have tried a lot of alternatives, but nothing seems to work. Does someone recognizes this problem and what can be done about it?
